findings.title: Unchecked return value of call to target
findings.explanation: In function go(), the contract executes target.call.value(msg.value)() without checking its boolean return. If the low-level call fails (e.g., the target fallback reverts or runs out of gas), the code will continue and forward the full balance to the owner, potentially diverting funds unintentionally. Always check the return value of low-level calls or use safe wrappers to ensure failures are handled as expected.
